task.title: Create and Name Layers
task.shortdesc: You can create an unlimited number of layers in every drawing and use those layers for organizing information. When you create a new layer, it is initially assigned the color white (or black, depending on your systemsettings) and the linetype CONTINUOUS. By default, a new layer is also visible. After you create and name a layer, you can change its color, linetype, visibility, and other properties.

context.p: Layers can have alphanumeric names up to 255 characters long.
In many cases, the layer names you choose are dictated by corporate, industry, or client standards. The Layer Properties Manager sorts layers alphabetically by name.

step.cmd: Choose Format > Layer from the mainmenu.
Type a name for the new layer.

info.p: To change a layer name in the current drawing

substep.cmd: Choose Format > Layer from the mainmenu.
In the Layer Properties Manager dialog box, click the name of the layeryou want to change.
Type a new name and click OK.

result.p: NOTE You cannot rename the 0 layer.
